SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A NOTE OF EXPLANATION TO THE PERSON ANSWERING THIS QUESTIONNAIRE

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who has lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Days: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Eat?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here and one will be sent to you.

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

( ) All questionnaires
( ) Pioneer health conditions
( ) Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
( ) Pioneer housing
( ) Pioneer education and churchwork
( ) Pioneer farming experience

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
1. Your full name: Mrs. A.O. Gibran

2. Your address: Brutton, Saskatchewan

3. Date: February 13th, 1953

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Granby Quebec

5. What was your father's name and occupation? Thomas Haley, factory worker then a farmer

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): April 27th, 1904

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: Granby Que.

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child", "I was in my teens", etc.): 15 yrs.

9. What were your reasons for coming West?
   Thinking it would be a better life, make more, an easier living as the west was considered the land of milk and honey.

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?):

11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?
   Thought we were very foolish; going to live among the Indians.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?
    "Father"

13. What means of transportation did you use? Train.

14. What incidents of the journey best do you remember? (People you met on the way,
    meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement,
    etc.)
    A very tiring, long trip, and never met Indians.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan? Caron Sask.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? Caron Sask.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.
    Condie Sask., now at Pratto Sask.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came?
    I was a school girl. Housework.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?
   Lonely, hard times, not much pleasure.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?
   Not very much, only until it was necessary, to church whenever it was possible, depending on the roads, and always with horses, 5 miles away.
